meanings.definition: Wet and dirty, as from being dragged through mud or water.
meanings.sent1: The bedraggled puppy looked sad after playing in the rain.
meanings.sent2: She arrived at the party looking bedraggled after walking in the storm.
meanings.sent3: The bedraggled cat shook off the water, creating a mini indoor rainstorm.
meanings.sent4: The bedraggled leaves clung to the tree branches like soggy confetti.
meanings.sent5: The bedraggled teddy bear had mud stains all over its fur.

meanings.sent1: The bedraggled hair of the little girl made her look like a wild explorer.
meanings.sent2: After the long hike, his clothes were bedraggled and covered in dirt.
meanings.sent3: The bedraggled scarecrow in the field seemed to have a messy hair day.
meanings.sent4: Her bedraggled room resembled a tornado aftermath.
meanings.sent5: The bedraggled bookshelf was overflowing with books in disarray.
